page.title: 13The Hamlet of Eaton
page.content: Eaton is a small farming community built on land belonging to St John's College. The Manor House, now a farm- house, was built in 1677 by the college as a refuge for Dons trying to scape the plague. The five original arms are now amalgamated into two - anor Farm and West Farm. There are only 60 people living in Eaton,some farmers and some commuters, all over 50 years old. The houses are too expensive for younger people to buy. Only one house is recently built, it being very difficult to obtain planning permission. An excellent closeknit community spirit is enjoyed by longstanding residents and relative newcomers. The local pub, 'The Eight Bells' , has a darts team and an Aunt Sally team. It is reputed to be{haunted}by a ghost known as Libby.
